user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Not entirely what the point of this beer is. Plain. Hardly a saison. Extremely subtle blackberry at the finish. Tastes almost flat.
beer_name: Vancouver Island Black Betty Blackberry Belgian Saison

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Grassy flavors, light grain. Not a whole lot going on here at all. Simple easy lager, really short finish.

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Pretty hot! Apricot is there at first, sweet, but then gets utterly blasted by the heat. Sort of unbalanced. Would be nice to pair with food, otherwise, a bit difficult to finish a whole pint. The back of the throat is rocked by heat. An experience non the less...

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Cloudy with a good amount of head with decent lacing. Much more rhubarb than previous batch last year. Actually a very nice beer. Patio Beer,

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Light lemon and gin on the nose. Comes in thin with a little cloudy and some small head. Not overally ginny, not overally lemony, a nice balance.

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Borderline IPA here. Thick, pretty heavy and got that IPA hop coming thru. Im getting a lot of honey and lemon merangue on the nose and palate. Decent.

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Weeeeow thats a Lotta flavor. Super tart. So much flavor its almost shocking. Beautiful on a patio but definitely too too much tart and fruit flavors for much more than one.
beer_name: Bomber Park Life Passion Fruit Ale

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Fizzy and citrus hit the tongue immediately. I get some apricot but not as much as I think they wanted me to. Taste more like a generic fruit flavor. Not over the top sour...pretty pungent.

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: This is a great IPA. Balenced tropical and floral hops with lemony pineappley flavors. Lightly carbonated, thin but not in a bad way, not overly rounded, hits home right away. Awesome.

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Clean crisp, good grains and balance. Simple fresh and exactly what I was hoping for. Easy drinking with a tidge of extra flavor to give it character.

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: I would have pulled back on the sugar a little bit but it is VERY flavorful. Big bold fruit flavor but too sweet. I like one, couldnt do a six pack too sweet.

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: GRAPEFRUITY. Easy drinking, is what it says it is. Beach beer. Nothing offensive, a bit sticky.

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Delish. Sweet and fruity, big tropical hops but very well balanced...juicy. Dangerously drinkable

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: pretty boring. No real stand out flavors or hop to it. The honey is definitely there and its enjoyable in the sun but nothing interesting goin on here folks.

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: i smell floral, spruce and citrus aromas. Clean dark gold pour with decent amount of head maintaining. A tad sweet, but not over the top. Medium bodied, with heavy malt and a tiny bite at the end. Just ok, probably the least interesting from the good people at Yellow Dog.
beer_name: Yellow Dog Chase My Tail Pale Ale

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Poured outta a tall can. Pours pretty gold with a small amount of head that diminishes quickly. Orange dominates the nose and tongue, sweet mandarin orange. Easy drinkin whatcha expect patio beer.
beer_name: Yellow Dog Sit and Stay India Session Belgian Ale (ISBA)

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Really nice beer. Zesty aroma and light cloudy pour. First you get the fruitiness and zestyness perfectly balanced with subtle hops in the nice crisp finish. Tasty AF.

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Damn near flawless! Light honey aroma, light blonde cloudy pour with slight head. Grainy but smooth. Not too much of a bite. A really classy beer, somewhat sticky. The carbonation is average, but it helps give the other flavors room on my palate. A real favorite of mine.

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Pours hazy, cloudy orange. Surprisingly dry, which makes it exceedingly drinkable. Pretty subtle fruit flavors. Not bold or fruit forward, just clean dry and crushable. Patio beer.

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Very delicious IPA. Great balance with the malts and hops, spicy, a ipa not afraid to be an ipa.

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: On tap at the brewery. Very boozy, unabashedly boozy. White wine smell, seems a little too in your face, not as balanced as it could be , but a pretty solid beer to sip on.
beer_name: Parallel 49 / Barkerville Run to the Hills

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Very balanced. Cloudy light brown pour. The hops and rye pair very well together and there is a long long finish. The Belgian aspect is subtle but delicious. Classic Four Winds craftmanship.
beer_name: Four Winds Phaedra Rye Wheat IPA

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Pretty boring. Light and easy drinking for a porter. The saltyness and the roastyness dont balance all that well in my opinion. Very little depth, thin.

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Surprisingly good. Very smooth, thicker feel in the mouth at first. Woody with pine flavors, with a dry malt dry mouth feel.
beer_name: Main Street Naked Fox IPA (formerly Odds n Sods IPA)

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Outta a bomber. Very clear golden colour. Doesnt have the classic pilsner bite, but is rounder. Not a ton of flavor here, just simple easy going.

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Golden amber color, didnt jive with the hop profile. Didnt have the depth of an IPA Im drawn too. Very citrus and grassy.

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Yum! Chocolatey malty well balanced burr poured out of a bomber. Seemed medium bodied, lively and delicious. Grabbed it from Coal Harbour Liquor Store.

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: I really enjoyed the hell out of this beer. Rich rich rich and smooth. Its all chocolate when it hits the tongue then the bourbon finish really completes the journey. Im not a stout guy at all, but I bought several. Its roasty, its toasty.

user_location: of Coal Harbour Liquor Store Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
review_blob: Tried it on tap at the brewery. Pretty clear and gold pour with light head. Aromas of grapefruit and resin. Flavors follow the same with dried tropical fruit and dusty malts. Pretty tasty, had two.
